sn2.21:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn2.21:1.3: Then, late at night, the glorious god Shiva, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn2.21:1.4: and recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn2.21:2.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:2.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:3.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:3.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:3.4: wisdom is gained—but not from anyone else.
sn2.21:4.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:4.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:4.4: you grieve not among the grieving.
sn2.21:5.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:5.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:6.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:6.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:6.4: sentient beings go to a good place.
sn2.21:7.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:7.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
sn2.21:8.1: Then the Buddha replied to Shiva in verse:
sn2.21:9.2: Try to get close to the virtuous!
sn2.21:9.3: Understanding the true teaching of the good,
